headers.subject: Re: [Proposal] V2.1 Release Candidate
headers.received: from e24.nc.us.ibm.com (32.97.136.230) by h31.sny.collab.net with SMTP; 30 Jan 2001 12:23:03 -0000
headers.x-mimetrack: Serialize by Router on D04NM204/04/M/IBM(Release 5.0.3 (Intl)|21 March 2000) at 01/30/2001 07:23:02 AM

body.para: Name changed. Perhaps someone else could post something to discuss.develop.com - I don't follow it. -Dug
To: <soap-dev@xml.apache.org> cc: Subject: Re: [Proposal] V2.1 Release Candidate
Can we please tag the nightly build as 2.1-rc1 (release candidate one) and put it out? I suggest posting announcements to soap@discuss.develop.com too to let people try things out.

quote.quotepara: ----- Original Message ----- From: "Doug Davis" <dug@us.ibm.com> To: <soap-dev@xml.apache.org> Sent: Monday, January 29, 2001 7:06 AM Subject: [Proposal] V2.1 Release Candidate

I'd like to propose using what's currently in the xml-soap cvs tree as release v2.1. I've built the code and it's available for people to play with at: http://xml.apache.org/dist/soap/soap-nightly.zip I know there are still open issues but I'd like to push them out until v2.2 - as I stated before there's no reason to not have a v2.2 in the near future - and I do feel it's important to release the good changes that have gone in over the past months. Unless a committer votes -1 to even thinking about doing this I'll wait a couple of days before creating a branch in the tree and then by Friday we'll take a final vote on the quality of the code. Sound ok? -Dug
